SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.helpers.parsers

Interface JsonParser<Class>

All Known Implementing Classes:
GoldCardParser, ObjectiveParser, StartingParser, StdCardParser
public interface JsonParser<Class>

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default Corner[]
    getCorners(com.google.gson.JsonArray corners)
    Parse the corners in the given json and return an array of corners of size 4 for the card constructor.
    the jsonArray can be obtained by using JsonObject.getAsJsonArray("corners")
    static Resource
    getResource(com.google.gson.JsonElement resource)
    Parse the resource data within the card json to use for both the goldCard and the stdCard constructors.
    takes as input the object obtained by using the card JsonObject.get("resource")
    Class
    parse()
    Returns a new object of the type specified by the parser from a json previously loaded in this object
    JsonParser<Class>

    Load a file from the given path in the parser so that it can be later parsed.
    the expected format is:
    JsonParser<Class>
    readString(String json)
    load a json as a string in the parser

  • Method Details

    • getResource

      static Resource getResource(com.google.gson.JsonElement resource)
      Parse the resource data within the card json to use for both the goldCard and the stdCard constructors.
      takes as input the object obtained by using the card JsonObject.get("resource")
      Parameters:
      resource - the JsonElement obtained from the element "resource" in cards.json
      Returns:
      the resource on the back of the card, (FUNGI, ANIMAL, PLANT or INSECT)

    • readFile

      JsonParser<Class> readFile(String path) throws IOException
      Load a file from the given path in the parser so that it can be later parsed.
      the expected format is:
      
  {
      "stdcards":[
          {
              "id":0,
              "resources": "resource",
              "corners": ["resource","resource","resource","resource"],
              "points": 0
          }, ...
      ],
      "goldcards":[
          {
              "id": 0,
              "resources": "resource",
              "corners": ["resource","resource","resource","resource"],
              "points": {
                  "value":0,
                  "type":"type"
              },
              "requirements":{
                  "RESOURCE":0
              }
          }, ...
      ],
      "startingcards":[
          {
              "id": 0,
              "resource": ["resource"],
              "frontcorners": ["resource","resource","resource","resource"],
              "backcorners": ["resource","resource","resource","resource"]
          }, ...
      ],
      "objectives":[
          {
              "id":0,
              "points":0,
              "type":type,
              "requirements": ["resource"] | {"resource": 0}
          }, ...
      ]
  }
      Parameters:
      path - path of the file from which to load the data for the cards
      Throws:
      IOException - Throws exception when the given file is missing
      See Also:
      • parse()

    • readString

      JsonParser<Class> readString(String json)
      load a json as a string in the parser
      Parameters:
      json - a string formatted as a json

    • parse

      Class parse() throws JsonFormatException
      Returns a new object of the type specified by the parser from a json previously loaded in this object
      Returns:
      a new object of the parser type by reading the json string obtained using
      invalid reference 
      readFile(path)
      or readString(json)
      Throws:
      JsonFormatException - when it encounters some json tags it cannot parse

    • getCorners

      default Corner[] getCorners(com.google.gson.JsonArray corners)
      Parse the corners in the given json and return an array of corners of size 4 for the card constructor.
      the jsonArray can be obtained by using JsonObject.getAsJsonArray("corners")
      Parameters:
      corners - a JsonArray obtained from the element "corner" in the json
      Returns:
      a corner array of size 4 generated from the given json element
